item.title: How the ZAC Browser Helps Autistic Kids
item.description:
Occasionally, you find a story that leaves you amazed. I recently encountered one such story, “Grandfather builds Web browser for autistic boy,” about a software developer who took action when his six-year-old grandson struggled to use the internet. This might not seem unusual at first, but the situation becomes clearer with more context. Zackary, the six-year-old grandson, has autism, making communication and interaction difficult, and he rarely speaks. He finds joy in games, music, and puzzles, many available online...
